Voice-activated Virtual Reality (VR) system: A VR headset that can be controlled by voice commands to simulateindind environments for the visually impaired.
Tactile Keyboard: A keyboard with raised buttons and braille letters that can be felt by the fingers, allowing visually impaired individuals to type and input information.
Smartphone App: An app that uses machine learning algorithms to recognize and describe objects in real-time,indelfindind the camera of the phone.
Haptic Feedback Gloves: Gloves with sensors that provide tactile feedback to the user, allowing them to feel textures and shapes of objects.

Eye-Tracking Technology: A device that tracks the movement of the eyes to control a computer or other devices, allowing visually impaired individuals to interact with technology without the need for physical input.
